question_content.description:
### Problem14

Consider a two-state DFA with a binary alphabet having the following transitions: Stay in state 0 if the input is 0 and stay in state 1 if the input is 1, otherwise switch to the other state. If state 0 is the accept state, which of the following does this DFA accept? 

**Choices:**

A. Bitstrings with an equal number of occurrences of 0 and 1  

B. Bitstrings with at least one 0 

C. Bitstrings with an equal number of occurrences of 01 and 10  

D. Bitstrings that end in 0  

E. Bitstrings with more 0s than 1s  

*From Coursera lecture slides <https://introcs.cs.princeton.edu/java/lectures/keynote/CS.14.IntroTheory.pdf>*
choices: A. Bitstrings with an equal number of occurrences of 0 and 1
B. Bitstrings with at least one 0
C. Bitstrings with an equal number of occurrences of 01 and 10
question_content.author: Yike Guo
